entities.label: Case 0580/03 - Control Failures at UNDP Bratislava

entities.id: Fraud under Slovakian Criminal Code, 1961: Article 250
entities.label: Fraud under Slovakian Criminal Code, 1961: Article 250

edges.label: 1. Subject of Investigation
edges.tooltip: UNDP Bratislava was investigated for control failures leading to fraud.

edges.label: 2. Financial Discrepancy Noted
edges.tooltip: UNON Finance noticed outstanding IOV and unreconciled payments linked to UNDP Bratislava.

edges.label: 3. Fraudulent Payments
edges.tooltip: The Consultant received fraudulent payments for travel, facilitated by UNDP Bratislava.

edges.label: 4. Verification of Forged Faxes
edges.tooltip: UNEP confirmed that fax instructions for disbursements were forged.

edges.label: 5. Violation Identified
edges.tooltip: Violation of Staff Rule 101.2(g) due to document manipulation.

edges.label: 6. Violation Identified
edges.tooltip: Violation of Staff Regulation 1.2 (b) due to lack of integrity.

edges.label: 7. Violation Identified
edges.tooltip: Violation of Staff Regulation 1.2 (g) due to misuse of office for private gain.

edges.label: 8. Violation Identified
edges.tooltip: Violation of Staff Regulation 1.2 (i) due to unauthorized communication of information.

edges.target: Fraud under Slovakian Criminal Code, 1961: Article 250
edges.label: 9. Violation Identified
edges.tooltip: Fraudulent activities breached Slovakian Criminal Code Article 250.

UNDP Bratislava: Forgery of fax instructions for disbursements.
The Consultant: Received fraudulent payments for travel to Johannesburg and Monrovia.

Staff Rule 101.2(g): Intentional alteration or destruction of official documents.
Staff Regulation 1.2 (b): Failure to uphold standards of efficiency, competence, and integrity.
Staff Regulation 1.2 (g): Use of office for private gain.
Fraud under Slovakian Criminal Code, 196: Fraud causing harm to property or enrichment through deceit.
